channel.title: Portable MoparScape
channel.description:
Hey, I was wondering of how I would make MoparScape portable so I can carry it on a thumb drive and it wouldn't need download the cache files. Would it be like possible to edit a variable somewhere in MoparScape to where it reads the cache files or is there a simpler solution?
Many thanks in advance. ;)

item.title: Portable MoparScape
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Just keep the JRE on your flash drive, and change the signlink.java in the client to look for the cache in the parent directory(…/cache/ if you wanted the cache directory with the other class files).

Read full topic

item.title: Portable MoparScape
item.dc:creator: @norec norec
item.description:
@norec wrote:

This might work, but something that you have to take into consideration is JDK (java development kit). I don’t think that any clients can run with out it. The only way that you could use such a program is if JDK is already installed on the computer. Other than that, you could just keep a zipped version of the original on a pen drive and extract it to the computer you are planing to use it on, which I know, kinda defeats the purpose of a portable application. Sorry I can’t be any more helpful, I hope I helped a bit.

Good luck!

Read full topic
